overview: Mexico, the late 60's. The nation is facing juvenile riots and Nancy Cardenas, playwright and stage director, initiates as a gay activist fighting for their rights. A struggle wrapped by her motto: 'Nobody is free until we all are free'. Friends, actors, intellectuals and personalities from Mexico share their thoughts about Nancy Cardenas's legacy in modern Mexico, where same sex marriage is a reality but still many wonder: are we all free?
title: Nadie es libre
